member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.ExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Base class extension attributes, defining extension points.

remarks.para: To define a new extension point, create a new attribute class, extending . The class must be annotated with the attribute, which indicates that the class defines an extension point.
Users can now create new extension classes annotated with the new extension attribute, and implementing a specified interface.
To get access to all the extensions registered with your extension point, use , specifying the type of your extension attribute. For more information, see .

When the plug-in manifest is generated, instances of the extension attribute are saved in the plug-in manifest using XML serialization. For that reason, make sure your extension attribute supports this (e.g. add a default constructor).

The framework also provides support for getting property values from the PluginResources.resx resource file, which is deployed together with the plug-in manifest. To specify that the value of a certain string property needs to be retrieved from the resource file, annotate the property definition with the attribute. Users should now specify the name of the resource key, instead of the actual value, as the property value. When no resource string with the specified key can be found, the framework keeps the specified string as the property value. To define non-string properties whose value is stored in the PluginResources.resx resource file, create a string property, which value should be set to a resource key. When consuming the extension, use tio retriece the resource from the plug-in resource file.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.ExtensionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for XML serialization.

member.summary: Constructor with required attributes.
member.param: The unique id for the extension.

The description for the extension. Should typically be a key of a resource string in PluginResources.resx.

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.IPlugin
member.summary: Represents a plug-in, which provides a number of extensions.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.IPlugin.SetEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the plug-in.
member.param: True to enable the plug-in.
member.returns: True if disabling the plug-in does not require restarting the application, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.IPlugin.GetPluginResource``1(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a resource of a specific type from the plug-ins resource file.
member.remarks: The plug-in resource file is a .Net resource file, with extension ".plugin.resources". For instance, when the plug-in manifest XML file is called "Myplugin.plugin.xml", the plug-in resource file should be called "MyPlugin.plugin.resources". Localized resources are supported by deploying additional resource files, following the naming convention "MyPlugin.plugin.LANGUAGECODE.resources".
member.param: The name of the resource in the resource file.
member.returns: The resource with the specified name, or null if the resource does not exist.
member.exception: Thrown when the resource with the specified name is not of the required type.

member.summary: Gets the status of this plug-in.
member.remarks: Only plug-ins with status are fully functional and can instantiate their extensions. Plug-ins that have not been initialized must be initialized before use by using .

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace contains the majority of the plug-in framework classes and interfaces. This includes the following:
The plug-in framework object model, which allows host applications to discover and instantiate extensions. The entry point for this is the class.
Support for developing extension points. See .

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.DefaultPluginLocator
member.summary: Implementation of a plug-in locator () which loads locates plug-ins within a directory on the local file system and an OpenExchange directory that contains sub-folders with individual plug-ins.

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.IPluginLocator
member.summary: Represents a plug-in locator, which is used by a plug-in registry to locate plug-ins.

remarks.para: The framework includes one implementation, , which loads locates plug-ins within a directory on the local file system.
The plug-in locator is automatically disposed when the plug-in registry that owns it is disposed.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.IPluginLocator.GetPluginDescriptors
member.summary: Returns an array of plug-in descriptors for plug-ins found.
member.returns: An array of plug-in descriptors.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.DefaultPluginLocator.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a default plug-in locator, which loads plug-ins from a "Plugins" subfolder of the installation folder and will optionally search in a specified Open Exchange plug-in location.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.DefaultPluginLocator.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Open Exchange plug-in locator using the specified plug-in search directory and Open Exchange directory.
member.param: The directory in which to look for plug-ins.
The directory in which to look for Open Exchange plug-ins.
The directory in which to look for plug-in packages to unpack or compare with.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.DefaultPluginLocator.GetPluginDescriptors
member.summary: Returns an array of plug-in descriptors for plug-ins found.
member.remarks: This locator looks for plug-in manifest files with the extension ".plugin.xml".
member.returns: An array of plug-in descriptors.

member.summary: Disposes the plug-in locator.
member.remarks: This method is called automatically when the owning plug-in registry is disposed.

member.summary: allows you to override the default setting in PluginConfigXml for enabling loading third-party plug-ins.

member.summary: Gets the system plug-ins directory.

member.summary: Gets the third-party plug-ins directory.

member.summary: Gets the directory where plug-in packages are located.

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ExtensionSorter
member.summary: Utility class that sorts sortable extensions.
member.remarks: This class only supports sortable extensions, i.e. extensions marked with an extension attribute that extends .

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ExtensionSorter.Sort(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.IExtension})
member.summary: Sorts the specified extensions according to the according to the and properties.
member.param: The extensions to sort.
member.returns: A sorted list of extensions.
member.exception: Thrown if one of the extensions specified does not target a sortable extenion point.

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ITopologicalSortable
member.summary: Interface to be implemented by classes that need to support sorting topologically using the class.

member.name: P:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ITopologicalSortable.Id
member.summary: Gets the id of the item.

member.name: P:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ITopologicalSortable.InsertBefore
member.summary: Returns the id of the item before which this item needs to appear. Can be null.

member.name: P:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ITopologicalSortable.InsertAfter
member.summary: Returns the id of the item after which this item needs to appear. Can be null.

member.name: P:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.ITopologicalSortable.Priority
member.summary: Returns the sorting priority of this item.
member.remarks: When two items specify the same criteria, for example InsertBefore=x, then the item with the highest priority, will be inserted right before x, followed by the item with the lower priority.

member.name: T:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.SortableExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Base class for extension attributes that allow specifying topological sort information.

remarks.para: Use this attribute as a base when developing extension points that require the ability for their extensions to specify the order in which they should be used.

In order to consume extensions of a sortable extension point, use if you want to create all extension instances at once. Use the class if you need more control over when the extensions are instantiated.

member.name: M:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.SortableExtensionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor for XML serialization.

member.summary: Constructor with required attributes.
member.param: The unique id for the extension.
The name for the extension. Should typically be a key of a resource string in PluginResources.resx.
The description for the extension. Should typically be a key of a resource string in PluginResources.resx.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the extension before which this extension should be inserted.

member.name: P:Sdl.Core.PluginFramework.Util.SortableExtensionAttribute.InsertAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the extension after which this extension should be inserted.

member.summary: Creates a plug-in registry containing plug-ins from the specified plugin directory.
member.remarks: Attach an event handler to this the even before calling this method to get notification about plug-ins that fail to load.
member.param: A plug-in locator to locate the plug-in manifest files to be loaded.
Determines which plug-ins can or cannot be loaded.
Object that initializes plug-ins before any if its extensions is loaded.
Loads a specific type part of a plug-in.
A plug-in cache object, that can be used to restore plug-in state.
A plug-in filter that controls whether certain plug-ins or individual extensions are loaded. Can be null.
True to validate all the plug-ins detected. Specify false to ensure lazy initialization.
member.returns: The newly created plug-in registry.

member.summary: Creates a plug-in registry containing plug-ins from the specified plugin directory.
member.remarks: Attach an event handler to this the even before calling this method to get notification about plug-ins that fail to load.
member.param: A plug-in locator to locate the plug-in manifest files to be loaded.
Determines which plug-ins can or cannot be loaded.
Object that initializes plug-ins before any if its extensions is loaded.
Loads a specific type part of a plug-in.
A plug-in cache object, that can be used to restore plug-in state.
True to validate all the plug-ins detected. Specify false to ensure lazy initialization.
member.returns: The newly created plug-in registry.
